evidence_explanation: The report documents two established violations: failure to enter a case contact timely and failure to complete a Relative Placement Safety Screen within required timeframes. The causes cited are individual worker performance, scheduling conflicts due to illness/vacation/death in family, and case transfer when a worker left the agency. There is no mention of understaffing, failure to meet ratios, operating below minimums, shift coverage gaps, or insufficient personnel as a cause or contributing factor.

evidence_keywords_found: ["insufficient staff", "only two staff", "not have enough staff", "had a third staff member present", "three staff on shift"]
evidence_quotes: ["There was insufficient staff to stop the fight sooner.", "Youth B reported there is usually three staff present but that evening there was only two.", "She said they could not restrain the two youths because they did not have enough staff to ensure that the two youths would not go after each other."]
evidence_explanation: The report explicitly documents insufficient staffing as a cause of the incident. The narrative states 'There was insufficient staff to stop the fight sooner' as part of the allegation, and multiple interviews confirm only two staff were present instead of the usual three. Staff directly attributed their inability to control the situation and use restraints to not having enough personnel.

evidence_quotes: ["Staff 1 did not maintain line-of-sight with Youth A, Youth B and Youth C.", "Staff 1 reported she stepped off the unit and took this youth to meet another staff person... leaving Youth A, Youth B, Youth C and one other youth alone on the unit.", "Staff 1 did not follow Great Lake Recovery Center Policy by maintaining line-of-sight on Youth A, Youth B and Youth C"]
evidence_explanation: The violation was caused by Staff 1's failure to maintain required line-of-sight supervision, not by insufficient staffing. The report documents that Staff 1 left youth unattended to escort another youth, violating supervision policy. No mention is made of understaffing, ratio violations, or coverage gaps as contributing factors.

evidence_keywords_found: ["sufficiency of staff", "ratio is one staff to three youth"]
evidence_quotes: ["The facility is found in compliance as there was sufficiency of staff at the facility.", "The facilities ratio is one staff to three youth.", "The facility is found in noncompliance for following their internal supervision policy as the facilities internal policy states staff will provide line of sight supervision however no staff had line of sight supervision on Youth B per video camera footage."]
evidence_explanation: The report explicitly states the facility was found in compliance with the sufficiency of staff rule. The violation was established for failing to follow the internal supervision policy (line of sight), not due to insufficient staffing levels, ratios, or coverage gaps. Staff were present and the required ratio was met, but their positioning and supervision practices were inadequate.

The report documents violations related to failure to follow up on medical needs, missing documentation, untimely casework entries, and failure to obtain signatures on service plans. No mention is made of staffing levels, ratios, coverage gaps, or insufficient personnel as a cause or contributing factor. The issues are attributed to individual staff performance, communication failures, and policy/procedural non-compliance.

The report does not mention understaffing, insufficient personnel, ratio violations, or shift coverage gaps as contributing factors. The violations stem from improper use of physical interventions, failure to follow CPI restraint protocols, lack of documentation, and individual staff misconduct. Three staff members were present during the incident, and the analysis focuses on their inappropriate actions and failure to follow policies, not staffing levels.
